result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy D Hortman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy D Hortman

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Case called at 10:17 AM) Defendant Roy D Hortman in court without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant did not attend the Settlement Conference with the District Attorney's Office. State recites the offer. Defendant wants to plea today. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- Obstructing an Officer. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding the right to an attorney. Defendant waives right to an attorney. Court accepts Defendant's waiver. 
Court orders Defendant to serve 4 days jail with 4 days credit, Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge, Court costs.

(11:00 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Roy D Hortman appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Roy D Hortman.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant didn't apply for Public Defender representation. Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on September 12, 2022 at 1:45 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Roy D Hortman
